channel.title: All kind of shits flying around
channel.description: Actually, this is just to test basics of a projectile engine. Change resX and resY for different window size. I am just not sure how to force it to refresh the debug image EVERY frame.

item.title: All kind of shits flying around
item.dc:creator: @Morgoth Morgoth
item.description:
@Morgoth wrote:

rom:

u r a dick

Seems that you haven’t read the forum rules, mate:
3. We don’t make spelling mistakes on purpose. We use “you” not “u”, we use “why” not “y” etc.
4. We don’t make posts that contain not useful information. Posts like “cool”, “lol”, “yeah” and “I agree” don’t contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all.
6. We respect each other and other communities. We don’t flame each other or other communities. We don’t fight on the forums.

rom, I suggest you to read the rest of the rules as well, so you don’t break more of them:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: All kind of shits flying around
item.dc:creator: @Morgoth Morgoth
item.description:
@Morgoth wrote:

It’s true about lag. Because it just keeps creating more and more objects And it also seems that the debug window canvas is not being really updated every frame. Because, even if rendering goes about ~24 fps, it visually seems like it is ~10 fps.

Read full topic
item.source: All kind of shits flying around

item.title: All kind of shits flying around
item.dc:creator: @Schmexi Schmexi
item.description:
@Schmexi wrote:

Hey wow. That’s neat! It looks a bit odd how when the circle is small, you can see the top image clearly, it kind of stands out, but I think that’s unavoidable. It’s very cool, but after a while gets quite laggy.

I think also it may help more people view it if you put the pictures in the script with BitmapToString, saves us lazy people to have to extract it.

Well done on that, it’s a great effect!

Read full topic
